list_definition.definition: (also fridgefridʒ) a machine which keeps food cold and so prevents it from going bad

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Milk should be kept in the refrigerator.

list_ex_of_english: After being allowed to set at room temperature, the plates were stored in a refrigerator overnight until the surface was dry.
Let us say, for example, that unbeknown to me my son has drunk the bottle of soda in the refrigerator.
I am thirsty and a bottle of soda is in the refrigerator.
The vial was tightly capped and stored in the family's refrigerator.
Colony counts were similar in case and control dishcloths and refrigerator swabs.
The sealed vials were time/date labeled and stored in a ziplocked bag in the family's refrigerator until collection was completed.
Just as an ant cannot comprehend a refrigerator, so an infant cannot grasp death.
Ownership of another consumer good, the refrigerator/freezer, also played a role in fishing activity.
